content.text: Hi, I'm Nicol√°s! A designer now turned front-end developer.

I'm passionate about creating user-friendly interfaces that are accessible to everyone. I achieve this by connecting the dots between design and development, coding interfaces, and performing accessibility tests.

Fascinated by computers, I've been sitting in front of them since I was 6 years old. My first one even had an [amber monitor.](https://www.google.com/search?q=amber+monitor+dos&tbm=isch&ved=2ahUKEwjak-y6yp-AAxVUxgIHHerQBj0Q0pQJegQIFRAB)

I'd love to tell you that I've been programming daily since my first course back in 2006 (HTML, CSS, Flash + ActionScript), but that wouldn't be true. I got carried away into the visual side of things, and studied Graphic Design. Nonetheless, my fascination for computers, code and the internet remained.
Today, I find myself wanting to experience the coding side of things. I now spend my time honing my front-end skills, drawing from open knowledge to teach myself, and having fun at it.
